summary:
Todoroki Steals His Father’s Credit Card
Inspired by @fenkko’s Instagram post
“Shoto...where did you get that?” You said...
body:
Todoroki Steals His Father’s Credit Card

Inspired by @fenkko’s Instagram post


“Shoto…where did you get that?” You said sighing, knowing the answer to your obvious question. Shoto chuckled and reached to caress your face.

“Why, from my father’s wallet,” He said in a smile so entrancing that you could forget the wrongful action he’d just commited.

“Do you really think that’s such a great idea?” You said cupping the right side of his face. “I mean, what will happen if he found out?”

“Well, I’m not really sure. I don’t think any of us actually thought of it before.” Relieved to know that he was self-reflecting, you couldn’t help but smile. “Wanna find out?” The warm smile on your face faded as you processed what he proposed. Before responding, you took a deep breath.

“Let’s think it through, Shoto,” You lovingly reached for the hand that held the card. “You don’t need to further harm your relationship. Let’s just hang out like we always do. We don’t need your father’s card.” Convinced, Todoroki complied and set the card on the table.

“You’re right. I don’t need his card.” His smile was so sweet you felt yourself melting.

“Oh shit. Is that Dad’s credit card?” Your body stiffened as you recognized the voice behind you. You turned to find Natsuo making his way over to the table. “Where’d you get this?” Todoroki turned his gaze away from you and focused it towards Natsuo.

“I got it from Dad’s wallet, but I’m planning on putting it back.” Todoroki turned to you with a smile, acknowledging the wrongful behavior he expressed. Natsuo teased Todoroki, messing with his hair.

“Aww, bummer. Or—” Natsuo paused. A smirk grew on his face. You knew Natsuo wouldn’t hesitate to use the card. The resentment he has against his father is too grand to change in such a short time. “We can go spend it all on soba noodles and sashimi.” At this point, Todoroki let go of your hands and followed Natsuo. Todoroki shrugged and stated that he couldn’t help himself.

“Technically Natsuo is using the card. I’m just reaping the benefits.” Standing in disbelief you pinched the bridge of your nose. A soft voice echoed throughout the room asking what was happening. You shot up. Ecstatic that Fuyumi might shake some sense into her younger brothers, you ran after her.

“Todoroki got ahold of his father’s credit card and now they plan on using it. Who knows how much they’ll spend.” Happily awaiting her response, Fuyumi walked up to her brothers.

“You guys, it’s not right to use Dad’s card. Yes, he has been difficult to deal with, but that doesn’t mean we—”

“We also plan on getting loads of ice cream” Natsuo interrupted, shaking the card in a tempting manner. Fuyumi debated mentally before she gave her final answer.

“I’ll see you later, [Y/N]!” You stood shocked as you watched Fuyumi prance towards her brothers. Their mouths drooled as they thought of all the food they’d get to eat. You turned to Todoroki for one last plea, but he merely shrugged and smiled in a childish way.

“What am I going to do with you lot?” You sighfully smirked and followed behind the siblings who were overflowing with happiness.

summary: Written for @yearonezine with accompanying art by @creemsicaal     Bakugou Katsuki's Five Tenets for Surviving Your First Year...
body:
Written for @yearonezine with accompanying art by @creemsicaal  

Bakugou Katsuki’s Five Tenets for Surviving Your First Year at UA High 

by Bakugou Katsuki

Okay, listen up, ‘cuz I ain’t gonna repeat myself.

So, you grew up thinking you were hot shit stuff; you ruled your middle school and now you think you have what it takes to become the number one hero in the world.

Think again, Extra.

Here are the facts, you ain’t special: statistically, biologically, nor competently.

So, to console your sorry ass soul as it deals with this harsh epiphany, here are my five rules for coping with your miserable existence:

  1. You don’t matter. You can’t make a difference in the long run.
  2. There’s no cause really worth fighting for. The only thing worth pledging your allegiance to is winning.
  3. Inspiration is for artists and losers who make excuses for not being able to do their job. The only thing you need to win is yourself.
  4. It’s not worth trying if you can’t even qualify for the unspoken rules of the game.
  5. You have limits. There will always be people intrinsically better than you. Accept that, and try to move on.

…

Now, if you nodded along to even one of those rules, pack up your bags and move to another school more suited to your mediocre reality.

‘Cuz we have no place for you, and even if we did that place would be better empty than wasted on someone who believes in nothing and no one, not even themselves.

UA High is not in the business of catering to the whims of those too fucking cowardly to face the harsh realities of the world.

We’re not a charity, and you will never be more than a sidekick for a D-list hero in a suburb.

For the few of you remaining, your fate is still to be decided. But since you haven’t managed to piss annoy me too much, here is what you need to know to survive your first year at UA High.

1. The only people in this world capable of creating change are the ones who can will it into reality.

Unlike what dear ole mom and dad might have told you, your quirk ain’t worth jack shit. It’s what you do with it that’ll shape your life as a hero. To be able to even begin to do that, you need an indomitable will. The kind of will that will give you the confidence to willingly run into a battle where you’ll be outnumbered and outgunned.

It’s not the size of the ship, but the motion of the ocean.

2. Heroes win. But they don’t become heroes because they win, they win because they’re heroes.

Great heroes show signs of their brilliance early on, so that every Tom, Dick and Harry can later boast to his buddies over beer as they all nurse their mid-life crisis, that they knew it all along.

If a battle is already won, then it’s not really a battle.

Any victory gained because of the incompetence of your opponents is not a victory worth celebrating.

Heroes win, and they win by a long shot, until no one can contest their superiority, but heroes don’t go into fights knowing they will win.

That’s not winning, that’s playing it safe.

3. Symbols matter.

I don’t quote a lot of people, but all you losers could learn a thing or two by reading The Art of War by Sun Tzu.

“The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.”

When you take away someone’s hope and inspiration, you take away their ability to fight back.

Break the spirit, and you have broken the man.

4. Don’t fit the requirements? Apply anyway.

The minute a hero disqualifies themselves from a position, that’s the moment they’ve truly lost.

Rejection is a bitch-ass mindset.

Accept it, and you become it.

Don’t be a reject.

5. Reached your body’s limits? Keep pushing.

Limitations are for lil bitches, fucking cowards, morons those who accept limitations.

While there might be people better than you right now, the only thing keeping them at the top is you and your lazy compliance.

Tear those idols off of their pedestals and claw your way to the top.

The only people who are limited are those who accept it.

And that’s it.

That’s all you need to know to survive your first year at UA High, if you have any questions, keep them to yourself, ‘cuz I don’t care. Don’t talk to me, I ain’t your friend.

And don’t forget, I’m better than you, and will crush you like the worthless ant you are.

Also, for fuck’s pete’s sake, learn how to use a knife.

trail.content_raw:
Written for @yearonezine with accompanying art by @creemsicaal  

Bakugou Katsuki’s Five Tenets for Surviving Your First Year at UA High 

by Bakugou Katsuki

Okay, listen up, ‘cuz I ain’t gonna repeat myself.

So, you grew up thinking you were hot shit stuff; you ruled your middle school and now you think you have what it takes to become the number one hero in the world.

Think again, Extra.

Here are the facts, you ain’t special: statistically, biologically, nor competently.

So, to console your sorry ass soul as it deals with this harsh epiphany, here are my five rules for coping with your miserable existence:

  1. You don’t matter. You can’t make a difference in the long run.
  2. There’s no cause really worth fighting for. The only thing worth pledging your allegiance to is winning.
  3. Inspiration is for artists and losers who make excuses for not being able to do their job. The only thing you need to win is yourself.
  4. It’s not worth trying if you can’t even qualify for the unspoken rules of the game.
  5. You have limits. There will always be people intrinsically better than you. Accept that, and try to move on.

…

Now, if you nodded along to even one of those rules, pack up your bags and move to another school more suited to your mediocre reality.

‘Cuz we have no place for you, and even if we did that place would be better empty than wasted on someone who believes in nothing and no one, not even themselves.

[[MORE]]

UA High is not in the business of catering to the whims of those too fucking cowardly to face the harsh realities of the world.

We’re not a charity, and you will never be more than a sidekick for a D-list hero in a suburb.

For the few of you remaining, your fate is still to be decided. But since you haven’t managed to piss annoy me too much, here is what you need to know to survive your first year at UA High.

1. The only people in this world capable of creating change are the ones who can will it into reality.

Unlike what dear ole mom and dad might have told you, your quirk ain’t worth jack shit. It’s what you do with it that’ll shape your life as a hero. To be able to even begin to do that, you need an indomitable will. The kind of will that will give you the confidence to willingly run into a battle where you’ll be outnumbered and outgunned.

It’s not the size of the ship, but the motion of the ocean.

2. Heroes win. But they don’t become heroes because they win, they win because they’re heroes.

Great heroes show signs of their brilliance early on, so that every Tom, Dick and Harry can later boast to his buddies over beer as they all nurse their mid-life crisis, that they knew it all along.

If a battle is already won, then it’s not really a battle.

Any victory gained because of the incompetence of your opponents is not a victory worth celebrating.

Heroes win, and they win by a long shot, until no one can contest their superiority, but heroes don’t go into fights knowing they will win.

That’s not winning, that’s playing it safe.

3. Symbols matter.

I don’t quote a lot of people, but all you losers could learn a thing or two by reading The Art of War by Sun Tzu.

“The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.”

When you take away someone’s hope and inspiration, you take away their ability to fight back.

Break the spirit, and you have broken the man.

4. Don’t fit the requirements? Apply anyway.

The minute a hero disqualifies themselves from a position, that’s the moment they’ve truly lost.

Rejection is a bitch-ass mindset.

Accept it, and you become it.

Don’t be a reject.

5. Reached your body’s limits? Keep pushing.

Limitations are for lil bitches, fucking cowards, morons those who accept limitations.

While there might be people better than you right now, the only thing keeping them at the top is you and your lazy compliance.

Tear those idols off of their pedestals and claw your way to the top.

The only people who are limited are those who accept it.

And that’s it.

That’s all you need to know to survive your first year at UA High, if you have any questions, keep them to yourself, ‘cuz I don’t care. Don’t talk to me, I ain’t your friend.

And don’t forget, I’m better than you, and will crush you like the worthless ant you are.

Also, for fuck’s pete’s sake, learn how to use a knife.

body:
Fight Part 2

So most of these events did happen to me when I was going through a break up. So I’m speaking from heart here. 💔

3 days. It’s been that long since your guys fight. It’s been 3 days since you stepped out of your room. It’s been 3 days since you last talked. It’s been 3 days since you last saw Kirishima.

You found yourself weaker than you even been. Your quirk would act up on different events and you would be reminded of how all of this was your fault. Your room was a mess from constantly trashing it when you got mad then you would cry and try to pick it back up but only for you to look at the old pictures and gifts from him and ended up crying and going back to bed.

You lost so much weight and you looked horrible. Your eyes burned and your throat was still raw from your guys fight. Bruises littered your hands from you punching your walls and your head was pounding from your constant blowing of your nose.

You couldn’t do anything about this. You couldn’t run back to Kirishima to help cheer you up because he was gone. You couldn’t smell his scent on his sweaters anymore because you soaked them with your tears. You couldn’t run because you had nowhere to go.

This was all your fault and you were paying the price.

So many times you cried and said you were sorry but you knew it was pointless. So many times you screamed his name until you couldn’t talk but you knew he wouldn’t come running back.

You felt numb from all the pain.

Your anxiety has gotten worse and you felt more panicky that ever. Your body shook every time you tried to pick yourself up, afraid that you’re doing something wrong. Your had nail marks in your skin form the constant fear because you couldn’t breath. You deserved this. You deserved all of this pain, is what you said to yourself. You didn’t deserve his love you didn’t deserve to call yourself a hero you didn’t deserve anyone’s kindness because deep down you knew it was because of you. You hurt him where it hurts the most. You broken him and you can’t fix it because you knew you would only make it worse.

‘Knock knock knock’

“Y/n it’s me Momo. Everyone is really worried about you. We’re afraid you haven’t been eating and your missing your classes.” She said

You didn’t bother answering. You didn’t bother getting up from your spot on the floor. What was the point?

You just turned over on your side away from your door and you felt yourself start to cry again. God how pathetic are you? You’re completely useless to them!!

Kirishima was right what kind of hero would you be if you can’t even control your quirk. Everything he said was right. You were a horrible person and you didn’t deserve anyone’s kindness or love.

Another hour passed and you heard your door knock again and you hear many different voices behind the door.

“Hey Y/n!!! You alright? We’re all kinda worried about you!! You haven’t been out in days and we’re starting to get scared!!” Midoryia’s voice said and you bit your lip

“Yeah Y/n we’re here for you to talk. We just want to make sure you’re okay. Can you please open the door?” Mina’s voice said and you covered your ears.

‘Go away. Can’t you see I deserve this?’

You let out a whimper and you shook your head.

‘Just go away. Go way go away go away!!!’

The rest of the week passed and you felt dead. The sun blinded you from a small crack in your curtains and you turned then sat up and you hissed. Your body was achy and weak.

Trying to stand up took everything you had and you had to lean against the wall for help. Your head throbbed again making your vision go dark. You looked at your alarm clock and saw it was Saturday late morning.

You sighed and went grabbed your water from your dresser and reached for it only for you to knock it over and you tried to catch it but your body collapsed and you whimpered again in pain.

‘Bang bang!!!’

‘No not this again.’

‘Bang bang bang!!!’

‘Just go away leave me to die.’

“Y/n!!! Get your ass out here now!!!” A loud voice demanded

“Easy Bakugo!”

“Yeah give her some slack she’s been through a lot.”

The two voices said and you heard Bakugo growled before he slammed your door again.

“I can’t fucking take this anymore!!! You better get your ass out here now or I’m breaking in!!” He yelled and your covered your ears and whimpered

‘No go way I can’t please don’t come in!!’

Your breath started to become uneven and you gripped your arms and started to scratch yourself.

“Dammit!! Y/n you’re fucking scaring us all!!! We all think you’re dead and shitty hair is losing his fucking mind!!” He said

‘No Kirishima isn’t he’s better off without me’

Your nails digged into your arms and you felt your lungs burn. God make this pain stop make it stop!!!!

Then you heard it.

The cracking of wood and the smell of smoke and you saw the light enter your room and you covered yourself as much as you could trying to shield yourself from them.

You saw the many shadows from your doorway. Looks like the whole class is here to see how much of a failure you are.

“Y/n?”

You flinched and your breath started to become even more unstable. Your heart pounded in your ear

‘No get out get out GET OUT!!!!!!!’

“Hey…y/n?”

No you can’t do this you aren’t ready!! God what should you do!?!? Dammit why won’t they leave!?!?! Just leave!?!?!

You heard the footsteps get closer and you pulled yourself closer. You couldn’t do this!?!? There’s too many of them!?!? You can’t fight them!?!?

“Hey.” Bakugo rough voice said and you flinched away from him and shook your head

“No no no no I can’t get out of my head… just get out I’m not ready..” you whimpered and then you felt his arms wrap around you and you tried to push against him but your body shook from the lack of energy and you soon found yourself passing out giving up all hope.

‘I can’t I’m not ready!!!’

Your had nail marks in your skin form the constant fear because you couldn’t breath. You deserved this. You deserved all of this pain, is what you said to yourself. You didn’t deserve his love you didn’t deserve to call yourself a hero you didn’t deserve anyone’s kindness because deep down you knew it was because of you. You hurt him where it hurts the most. You broken him and you can’t fix it because you knew you would only make it worse.

‘Knock knock knock’

“Y/n it’s me Momo. Everyone is really worried about you. We’re afraid you haven’t been eating and your missing your classes.” She said

You didn’t bother answering. You didn’t bother getting up from your spot on the floor. What was the point?

You just turned over on your side away from your door and you felt yourself start to cry again. God how pathetic are you? You’re completely useless to them!!

Kirishima was right what kind of hero would you be if you can’t even control your quirk. Everything he said was right. You were a horrible person and you didn’t deserve anyone’s kindness or love.

Another hour passed and you heard your door knock again and you hear many different voices behind the door.

“Hey Y/n!!! You alright? We’re all kinda worried about you!! You haven’t been out in days and we’re starting to get scared!!” Midoryia’s voice said and you bit your lip

“Yeah Y/n we’re here for you to talk. We just want to make sure you’re okay. Can you please open the door?” Mina’s voice said and you covered your ears.

‘Go away. Can’t you see I deserve this?’

You let out a whimper and you shook your head.

‘Just go away. Go way go away go away!!!’

The rest of the week passed and you felt dead. The sun blinded you from a small crack in your curtains and you turned then sat up and you hissed. Your body was achy and weak.

Trying to stand up took everything you had and you had to lean against the wall for help. Your head throbbed again making your vision go dark. You looked at your alarm clock and saw it was Saturday late morning.

You sighed and went grabbed your water from your dresser and reached for it only for you to knock it over and you tried to catch it but your body collapsed and you whimpered again in pain.

‘Bang bang!!!’

‘No not this again.’

‘Bang bang bang!!!’

‘Just go away leave me to die.’

“Y/n!!! Get your ass out here now!!!” A loud voice demanded

“Easy Bakugo!”

“Yeah give her some slack she’s been through a lot.”

The two voices said and you heard Bakugo growled before he slammed your door again.

“I can’t fucking take this anymore!!! You better get your ass out here now or I’m breaking in!!” He yelled and your covered your ears and whimpered

‘No go way I can’t please don’t come in!!’

Your breath started to become uneven and you gripped your arms and started to scratch yourself.

“Dammit!! Y/n you’re fucking scaring us all!!! We all think you’re dead and shitty hair is losing his fucking mind!!” He said

‘No Kirishima isn’t he’s better off without me’

Your nails digged into your arms and you felt your lungs burn. God make this pain stop make it stop!!!!

Then you heard it.

The cracking of wood and the smell of smoke and you saw the light enter your room and you covered yourself as much as you could trying to shield yourself from them.

You saw the many shadows from your doorway. Looks like the whole class is here to see how much of a failure you are.

“Y/n?”

You flinched and your breath started to become even more unstable. Your heart pounded in your ear

‘No get out get out GET OUT!!!!!!!’

“Hey…y/n?”

No you can’t do this you aren’t ready!! God what should you do!?!? Dammit why won’t they leave!?!?! Just leave!?!?!

You heard the footsteps get closer and you pulled yourself closer. You couldn’t do this!?!? There’s too many of them!?!? You can’t fight them!?!?

“Hey.” Bakugo rough voice said and you flinched away from him and shook your head

“No no no no I can’t get out of my head… just get out I’m not ready..” you whimpered and then you felt his arms wrap around you and you tried to push against him but your body shook from the lack of energy and you soon found yourself passing out giving up all hope.

‘I can’t I’m not ready!!!’

by aalien

In a world where everyone has a mark of a flower somewhere on their body in the color of their soulmate’s eyes, it’s hard to miss the one you’re destined to be with.

Midoriya, however, has two marks. A gray and blue lily lays on his right wrist, and a bright red rose with petals falling off of it sits on his left.
